update.description:
Updated the simulations code, to expect a stopCmd that will be invoked to stop the simulation. Before this PR , a 'kill' was invoked on the previously run 'cmd'. 

Also added some default commands for running and stopping gazebo docker container (src specifics).

Some changes that could be done and some warnings: 

- allow the stopCmd to be 'optional'. If not present, then just invoke kill.

- currently, the docker container name is assumed to be 'gazebo_run'. If due to some reason there are issues with killing the container, then we will not be able to launch another container using the same docker container name. But I think we don't want to have multiple running docker containers either, so the root problem is to be able to smoothly stop a docker container...maybe in such scenarios the admin will login to the instance? Note: if we just kill the docker container (docker kill / docker stop) it seems we don't allow gazebo write its logs. So we need to close it using SIGINT signal.
update.title: add support for 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd' in simulations, and other changes

content.raw:
That sounds like a good idea. Not sure how hard it is to do that though. A couple other options I see:

* Set up https for all instances
* Put a simple UI on the instances (for example  http://52.53.155.198:4000/simulation). cloudsim.io could open that on a new tab
content.html:
That sounds like a good idea. Not sure how hard it is to do that though. A couple other options I see:

  • Set up https for all instances
  • Put a simple UI on the instances (for example http://52.53.155.198:4000/simulation). cloudsim.io could open that on a new tab

content.raw:
Yup, so what I understand happened was:

* I started the machines
* I couldn't start docker because my browsers are blocking mixed content requests (from https://dev.cloudsim to http://<simulator ip>)
* Ian's browser is not blocking mixed content, so he pressed the button and the docker started

So now I'm using swagger to do a `GET /stopsimulation` and that works, because it's from http to http)
content.html:
Yup, so what I understand happened was:

  • I started the machines
  • I couldn't start docker because my browsers are blocking mixed content requests (from https://dev.cloudsim to http://<simulator ip>)
  • Ian's browser is not blocking mixed content, so he pressed the button and the docker started

So now I'm using swagger to do a GET /stopsimulation and that works, because it's from http to http)

and I've ssh'd to your instance and it seems docker is running

It takes a while until the node server (and later the simulation) are loaded . I guess we will need to keep that in mind in the widgets/portal side, so as to block the competitor from trying to launch operations if the server is still not ready

and I've ssh'd to your instance and it seems docker is running

pull_request.title: add support for 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd' in simulations, and other changes

update.description:
Updated the simulations code, to expect a stopCmd that will be invoked to stop the simulation. Before this PR , a 'kill' was invoked on the previously run 'cmd'. 

Also added some default commands for running and stopping gazebo docker container (src specifics).

Some changes that could be done and some warnings: 

- allow the stopCmd to be 'optional'. If not present, then just invoke kill.

- currently, the docker container name is assumed to be 'gazebo_run'. If due to some reason there are issues with killing the container, then we will not be able to launch another container using the same docker container name. But I think we don't want to have multiple running docker containers either, so the root problem is to be able to smoothly stop a docker container...maybe in such scenarios the admin will login to the instance? Note: if we just kill the docker container (docker kill / docker stop) it seems we don't allow gazebo write its logs. So we need to close it using SIGINT signal.
update.title: add support for 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd' in simulations, and other changes

pull_request.title: add support for 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd' in simulations, and other changes

pullrequest.title: add support for 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd' in simulations, and other changes

content.raw:
@iche033 @chapulina there are some improvements that can be done in the code, but the start/stop of simulations using cloudsim-sim can be tested using the lastest widgest from SRC rounds. For the machine hardware in the SRC rounds you should set ami-ea56728a.
Hope this helps!
content.html: @iche033 @chapulina there are some improvements that can be done in the code, but the start/stop of simulations using cloudsim-sim can be tested using the lastest widgest from SRC rounds. For the machine hardware in the SRC rounds you should set ami-ea56728a. Hope this helps!

pull_request.title: add support for 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd' in simulations, and other changes

update.description:
Updated the simulations code, to expect a stopCmd that will be invoked to stop the simulation. Before this PR , a 'kill' was invoked on the previously run 'cmd'. 

Also added some default commands for running and stopping gazebo docker container (src specifics).

Some changes that could be done and some warnings: 

- allow the stopCmd to be 'optional'. If not present, then just invoke kill.

- currently, the docker container name is assumed to be 'gazebo_run'. If due to some reason there are issues with killing the container, then we will not be able to launch another container using the same docker container name. But I think we don't want to have multiple running docker containers either, so the root problem is to be able to smoothly stop a docker container...maybe in such scenarios the admin will login to the instance? Note: if we just kill the docker container (docker kill / docker stop) it seems we don't allow gazebo write its logs. So we need to close it using SIGINT signal.

pull_request.title: add support for 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd' in simulations, and other changes

update.description:
Updated the simulations code, to expect a stopCmd that will be invoked to stop the simulation. Before this PR , a 'kill' was invoked on the previously run 'cmd'. 

Also added some default commands for running and stopping gazebo docker container (src specifics).

Some changes that could be done and some warnings: 

- allow the stopCmd to be 'optional'. If not present, then just invoke kill.

- currently, the docker container name is assumed to be 'gazebo_run'. If due to some reason there are issues with killing the container, then we will not be able to launch another container using the same docker container name. But I think we don't want to have multiple running docker containers either, so the root problem is to be able to smoothly stop a docker container...maybe in such scenarios the admin will login to the instance? Note: if we just kill the docker container (docker kill / docker stop) it seems we don't allow gazebo write its logs. So we need to close it using SIGINT signal.
update.title: Support 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd'

pull_request.title: add support for 'stopCmd' and 'logsCmd' in simulations, and other changes

content.raw:
yes, although the commands , as they are today, should be prefixed with src_commands/ . For example: src_commands/stop_gazebo.bash . 
Also for the specific run_gazebo command, as it is now, we need to pass the world name as argument. For example src_commands/run_gazebo.bash pioneer2dx

content.raw:
Just verifying how we should call the APIs on the client, something like this?

~~~
# Start simulation
POST: /simulations
{
  cmd: 'run_gazebo.bash',
  stopCmd: 'stop_gazebo.bash',
  logCmd: 'send_logs.bash',
  auto: true
}

# Stop simulation
GET: /stopsimulations
~~~
